item.title: 165 – Late Night Haiku
item.dc:creator: Graham
item.description: 164 – Late Night Haiku Cleverness isn’t accidental genius is cleverer by half
item.content:encoded:
164 – Late Night Haiku

Cleverness isn’t
accidental genius is
cleverer by half

item.title: 164 – Still Life with Gourd and Summer Squash
item.dc:creator: Graham
item.description: Still Life with Gourd and Summer Squash Orange grooved gourd nestles yellow summer squash’s sensuous curve huddled in a robin’s egg blue bowl in plain sight on a window sill for anyone to see where I spy them while walking … Continue reading →
item.content:encoded:
Still Life with Gourd and Summer Squash

Orange grooved gourd
nestles yellow summer
squash’s sensuous curve
huddled in a robin’s egg
blue bowl in plain sight
on a window sill
for anyone to see
where I spy them
while walking by.

I blush faintly nectarine
under my collar, flush
with their brazen coupling
and the sudden salivating
prickle tickling my taste buds.

item.title: 163 – Blurry Portuguese
item.dc:creator: Graham
item.description: Blurry Portuguese the beautiful game a pitched samba battle in the street in the favelas sprouting pirate radio spilling blurry Portuguese speaking Spanish with a mouth full of marbles into my living room I don’t need language I get the … Continue reading →
item.content:encoded:
Blurry Portuguese

the beautiful game
a pitched samba battle

in the street
in the favelas

sprouting pirate radio
spilling blurry Portuguese

speaking Spanish
with a mouth full of marbles

into my living room
I don’t need language

I get the meaning straight
from the words

goal sounds the same
in every tongue

item.title: 162 – Alamo
item.dc:creator: Graham
item.description: Alamo My brother’s in the wild panhandling his way down through Tejas-land America’s bladed edge. His sister hails from the flatland de la frontera. He carries dual citizenship, crossing freely from one family to another though not without hazard. Coyotes. … Continue reading →
item.content:encoded:
Alamo

My brother’s in the wild
panhandling his way down
through Tejas-land
America’s bladed edge.
His sister hails from the flatland
de la frontera.
He carries dual citizenship,
crossing freely
from one family to another
though not without hazard.
Coyotes. Saguaro. Leaching
water into hard pan.
This northern corner of the world
runs down, flattens, drains
of wet color, empty
but for possibility. I wait
in rain shadow
for a call to come
crackling through the static
of a truck stop payphone,
ask him how he finds the Alamo,
what he sees out on in the endless draw
under the light of one lone star?

item.title: 161 – Unanswered
item.dc:creator: Graham
item.description: Unanswered You’re nowhere near the high school shooting this morning but I call anyway unsettled triggered by tragedy passing by I falter in the empty space of endless tones hoping for the click and latch of your voice breaking in … Continue reading →
item.content:encoded:
Unanswered

You’re nowhere near
the high school shooting
this morning but
I call anyway
unsettled
triggered by tragedy
passing by

I falter in the empty space
of endless tones
hoping
for the click and latch
of your voice breaking
in

I return to the world
of solid things

Somewhere
in a backpack
or an empty locker
or thrown into a field,
a phone is left
to ring

and ring

item.title: 160 – Gratitude
item.dc:creator: Graham
item.description: Gratitude His hands poke out of frayed Army cuffs and envelope mine. He says, if he wanted, he could snap my spine. Snap. Like that. He smiles and accepts my gift of leftover birthday cake, a corner piece smothered in … Continue reading →
item.content:encoded:
Gratitude

His hands poke out of frayed Army cuffs
and envelope mine.
He says, if he wanted, he could
snap my spine. Snap. Like that.
He smiles and accepts my gift
of leftover birthday cake,
a corner piece smothered
in frosting and the end
of a woman’s name.
His deadly handshake reciprocity
for sweetness. I wait in fear
for the bus. His eyes lock
far away. He asks again
for the change
I can’t give him.

item.title: 159 – Subdue
item.dc:creator: Graham
item.description: Subdue I am the reason for concern in the wild. Alert yourselves to my stumbling destruction. There’s no reason other than I am. Call and responsecousin kin keep alive away the hand of man inglorious insensitive to fern’s slender growth … Continue reading →
item.content:encoded:
Subdue

I am the reason for concern
in the wild. Alert yourselves
to my stumbling destruction.
There’s no reason other
than I am. Call and responsecousin kin keep alive
away the hand of man
inglorious insensitive
to fern’s slender growth
fir’s need to wait.
Trod heavy-footed down
bark and dirt, cave
in molehills, idle
and crush the last wild flower.
Threaten the idyll by idling.
Larch call is grief,
river cries against its stones
to the sea.

item.title: 158 – Powwow
item.dc:creator: Graham
item.description: Powwow They arrive in groups of two or three or alone, leaving cars in the lot. Weekenders channeling a spirit they’re read of, been told is in them, buried, like a seed wrapped in dead salmon. Dig out the root … Continue reading →
item.content:encoded:
Powwow

They arrive in groups of two or three
or alone, leaving cars in the lot. Weekenders
channeling a spirit they’re read of,
been told is in them, buried, like a seed
wrapped in dead salmon.

Dig out the root of the navel,
pull open, see what sprouts. Lilac
or nightshade. Bloody Indian corn
to braid. Fields of wheat, soybeans,
tobacco, cotton.

Native chanting on loop.
Beaded vests bought cheap
at roadside diners. Dream catchers.
Fireside tales of animals
giving up their names in fur
and skin.

Bang a drum slowly.
Deep-throated chanting drowns
out the wind in the firs,
the soft movements all around.

item.title: 157 – Firs
item.dc:creator: Graham
item.description: Firs skins zippered whole but bearing teeth marks rounded burl of sap and matted tissues girth & growth come w/blood letting weeping thick ribbons of loss pulse just under seams of weakness binding shiver cold radiate remembrance in the wind … Continue reading →
item.content:encoded:
Firs

skins zippered whole but bearing teeth
marks rounded burl of sap
and matted tissues girth & growth
come w/blood letting weeping
thick ribbons of loss pulse
just under seams of weakness binding
shiver cold radiate remembrance
in the wind the saw sounds keening
hairline fractures pinging ancient hurt
cut each body open to soft inner
barks bloody read the lifeline
down to the roots

item.title: 156- Contigo
item.dc:creator: Graham
item.description: Contigo the lid of my Chinese-made travel mug speaks in Spanish, stamped with the language of love I am bleary eyed, early waking to green Douglas fir & bird sentries watching over me the Sandy River hauling its net of … Continue reading →
item.content:encoded:
Contigo

the lid of my Chinese-made travel mug
speaks in Spanish, stamped
with the language of love

I am bleary eyed, early waking
to green Douglas fir
& bird sentries watching over me

the Sandy River hauling its net
of sound about my feet
& ears, lulling

con tigo con tigo
it’s the dream I had twisting
the silk of my sleeping

bag around anxious legs, knees
the emptiness where yours are
not

this watered-down coffee is longing
I drink, filling up but never
quite enough
